definition: to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: From its nest the bird flew down and fanned the embers with its wings.
sentences.chinese: 知更鸟从它的巢中飞下来，用它的翅膀扇着火的灰烬。

sentences.english: Dense smoke coming out of No. 4 engine cowling (engine nacelle), fire suspected.
sentences.chinese: 第四号发动机整流罩冒浓烟，可能着火。

sentences.english: The police battered the door down and rescued the children from the burning house.
sentences.chinese: 警察把门砸坏，于是从那着火的房子里救出了孩子们。

sentences.english: Clothing which is fire-resistant in air maybe readily ignitable in oxygen-enriched atmospheres.
sentences.chinese: 在空气中防火的衣服在富氧大气中可能很容易着火。

sentences.english: I sat for a while with the motor running, and looked.
sentences.chinese: 我坐着看了一会儿，车发动机着着火。

sentences.english: The enemy aircraft plunged down in flames before the pilot had time to bail out.
sentences.chinese: 敌飞行员还没来得及跳伞，飞机就冒着火栽下来了。

sentences.english: No chemical mystery there: Where there’s fire, there’s smoke.
sentences.chinese: 这里没有化学的秘密，哪里着火哪里就冒烟。

sentences.english: She was rescued from a burning building.
sentences.chinese: 她被从着火的大楼里救了出来。

sentences.english: The building caught fire , and blazed up.
sentences.chinese: 那座建筑物着火燃烧起来了。

sentences.english: The Forest Service says it is responding to 19 new fires.
sentences.chinese: 森林服务中心称，此后果是19处新的着火点造成的。

sentences.english: We have news that the plane caught fire after crashing," Rohit Katiyar, a top airport security official, told Reuters.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到的消息是飞机在坠毁之后着火了。

sentences.english: Clothing which is fire - resistant in air maybe readily ignitable in oxygen - enriched atmospheres .
sentences.chinese: 在空气中防火的衣服在富氧大气中可能很容易着火。

sentences.english: You consider it a badge of honor when you get your hand guards burst into flames.
sentences.chinese: 你认为把护木打的着火是一项荣耀。

sentences.english: The dragster actually snapped in two and burst into flames. Amazingly, the driver walked away.
sentences.chinese: 这辆高速赛车实际上已经折断成两截并着火。

sentences.english: The 28-story building was under renovation when it went up in flames
sentences.chinese: 这座28层楼的建筑，在着火时正在修理。

definition: to catch fire/to cook/to get angry
to discharge smoke/to fume with rage
